title: Executive Assistant to the Registrar
organization: South African Council for the Property Valuers Profession (SACPVP)
description: We invite applications from exceptional administrative professionals for the position of Executive Assistant to the Registrar. This role provides strategic, high-level administrative and personal support that enables the Registrar to focus on governance, stakeholder relations, and advancing the Council's mandate.
requirements: Submit a single PDF containing: A concise cover letter (no longer than one page), detailed CV with at least three contactable referees, and certified copies of qualifications and ID.

title: Deputy Director: Valuations
description: Manage the Municipal valuations and Ad-hoc valuations to provide an efficient valuation service within the Directorate and to the clients of the City of Johannesburg.
requirements: B. Degree/NQF level 7 in Real Estate; Property Valuation or a qualification recognized by the SA Council for the Property Valuers' Profession

title: Senior Manager: Valuation Services
description: Lead, direct, plan, develop and manage Property Valuations in the designated regions within the City of Johannesburg with regard to the compilation and maintenance of Valuation Rolls.
requirements: Degree/NQF level 7 in Real Estate: Property Valuation or a qualification recognised by the South African Council for the Property Valuers Profession (SACPVP)

title: Valuer
description: Undertake specific tasks associated with all aspects of property valuations, including property market research and the physical attributes of property as well as fieldwork.
requirements: National Diploma / NQF level 6 in Real Estate: Property Valuation or a qualification recognised by the South African Council for the Property Valuers Profession (SACPVP)

title: Executive Assistant to the Registrar
description: The Executive Assistant (EA) will provide high-level administrative and personal support to the Registrar. Responsibilities include managing schedules, coordinating meetings, handling correspondence, and ensuring efficient day-to-day operations. The EA must be highly organized, proactive, and capable of handling sensitive information with discretion.
requirements:
- Diploma or degree in Business Administration, Secretarial Studies, or a related field
- 2 to 5 years of experience in a similar role
- Proficient in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)
- Excellent verbal and written communication
- Strong organizational and time-management skills
- Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
- High level of professionalism and confidentiality
- Strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills
